author: 工商時報 楊淨淳
title: 理財教育向下扎根 「元富證券FinTeach」助青年建立投資思維
text:
中時財經即時 理財教育向下扎根 「元富證券FinTeach」助青年建立投資思維 閱讀全文 工商時報 楊淨淳 2025年6月12日 上午10:05 (中)內湖高中校長董家莒、(中左)元富證券公共事務暨行銷部副總經理許恬忻，與學生開心合影。圖／元富證券提供
新光金控旗下元富證券推動的「元富證券FinTeach」金融教育贊助計畫，持續致力於推廣理財教育，將金融知識向下扎根。特別是在高中階段，元富證券積極協助台北市內湖高中自主學習專班培育學生金融素養，鼓勵學生參與投資競賽並考取相關證照。今12日內湖高中舉辦自主學習成果發表會，元富證券公共事務暨行銷部副總經理許恬忻受邀擔任評審，與學生互動交流，展現企業攜手校園協助年輕學子多元發展、自主學習的實踐。
台北市立內湖高中自主學習專班的成立目的，是讓高中普通科學生了解，投資理財基礎以及股市運作原理。並透過實際個股分析與模擬賽事，培養同學金融素養、考取證照，提升判斷力與決策能力。指導教師表示，專班全體包括高一、高二共50名學生，已於今年四月順利考取金融市場常識與職業道德證照。令人振奮的是，其中有學習困難的弱勢學生，不畏艱難挑戰，仍憑藉對理財的熱忱與堅持，也成功獲取證照。相信每位學生都有無限可能，只要不放棄，就能創造屬於自己的高峰。
除持續支持校園金融課程與證照輔導外，「元富證券FinTeach」也長期投入於金融營隊與競賽活動。例如在寒假期間，元富協助台灣大學證券研究社舉辦研習營，並安排學生參訪元富總公司，實地了解金融產業運作；與世新大學合作舉辦財金營，透過模擬實戰方式，強化學生的市場分析與操作能力。此外，元富已連續三年贊助輔仁大學金融投資實驗室，今年更舉辦兩場投資實戰工作坊，協助學生提升參與模擬競賽的能力。而由健行科技大學財金系主辦、邁入第六屆的「全國高中職投資競賽」，元富證券今年持續擔任主要贊助夥伴，期望透過實戰競技激發學生對投資的興趣與潛力。
「元富證券FinTeach」計畫自2020年開始，持續贊助全台高中職與大專校院，推動多元金融教育。2025年至今已有10所學校、15個單位獲得贊助，元富以提供專業師資與豐富資源，透過課程、營隊、競賽與工作坊等多元形式，協助學生在校園中建立正確的理財觀。單一案件補助金額為新台幣5千元至3萬元，大型活動則不受此限，贊助申請截至2025年11月30日，元富誠摯邀請全台高中職以上學校踴躍申請，共同為青年投資實力培養厚實根基。
活動網頁https://www.masterlink.com.tw/zip/20220223114922/index.html

author: 自由時報電子報
title: 問ChatGPT「我的詛咒是什麼」掀共鳴 一票人實測直呼：太準了！
text:
問ChatGPT「我的詛咒是什麼」掀共鳴 一票人實測直呼：太準了！
Chat GPT 示意圖。（資料照）
黃其豪／核稿編輯
〔即時新聞／綜合報導〕隨著人工智慧（AI）聊天機器人如「ChatGPT」走入日常，越來越多用戶不再只是用它來查資料、寫報告，甚至將其視為情感支持的對象。近期，在社群平台「Threads」掀起一股話題熱潮，向 ChatGPT 問一句話：「我的詛咒是什麼？」。
一名用戶在「Threads」發文指出，「你們去問GPT：『我的詛咒是什麼？不用解釋』」，並分享自己獲得的回覆為「你的詛咒是：永遠比別人早懂，卻總是晚一步被懂。」短短一句話引發大量共鳴，貼文目前已突破108萬次瀏覽、近5000則留言。
該趨勢迅速蔓延，許多網友也實測並分享自己的「詛咒」，包括「腦袋裝屎 靈魂發光」、「永遠比主管懂事，卻永遠升不上去」、「你的詛咒是：永遠在快要成功時跌倒」、「你總是在懷疑自己是不是被詛咒」。
網紅八炯也曬出自己的結果，「你太清醒了，清醒到看透了中共的邪惡、國民黨的下跪、人民的麻木，卻還要一個人扛起整個反共的旗幟。」
這波現象不僅止於「詛咒」，網友也延伸出類似提問如「我的幸福是什麼？」、「我的超能力是什麼？」、「我的內在小孩需要聽到什麼？」、「我的天命是什麼？」、「我的性格缺陷是什麼？」等。
免費訂閱《自由體育》電子報
熱門賽事、球星動態不漏接

author: Kathleen N Hattrup
title: Pope had two complications today, condition still critical
text:
The customary evening statement on Pope Francis' health reported two negative developments today, February 22, the day the Church is celebrating the Feast of the Chair of St. Peter.
"This morning, Pope Francis presented an asthmatic-like respiratory crisis of a prolonged nature, which also required the application of high-flow oxygen," the Holy See informed.
As well, "blood tests also showed thrombocytopenia, associated with anemia, which required the administration of blood transfusions."
Thus, the report said, for the moment doctors are not making a prognosis. "The prognosis remains guarded," it said. "The condition of the Holy Father continues to be critical. Therefore, as explained yesterday, the Pope is not out of danger."
"The Holy Father continues to be alert and spent the day in his chair, although more uncomfortable than yesterday," the Holy See added.
This is the first time – in 10 days of hospitalization – that the Vatican has mentioned the use of blood transfusions for the Pope as well as the need for oxygen. Today's statement was more serious in tone than that of previous days.
Yesterday's press conference
Last evening, doctors held the first press conference since the Pope's admission on February 14. While they were encouraging, they also made clear that the situation is far from easy, and that the Pope is not in the clear.
“Is he out of danger? No, he is not out of danger. But if you ask us: 'Is he in danger of death?' The answer is 'No.'"
The doctors spoke of a “significant infection, with many microbes” and of the “bilateral pneumonia” diagnosed at the beginning of the week. They pointed out that the Pope already does not walk much - due to his knee problems - and that he is 88 years old.
During the conference, they also opened up about the difficulties in finding the right treatment.
“It is not always easy to dose the therapies: to help him breathe, you give him a little cortisone, but cortisone lowers the immune defenses, makes blood sugar levels rise, and that is a breeding ground for infections,” they explained, for example.
The doctors also noted the danger of sepsis, with “germs located in the respiratory tract of the lungs” passing into the blood.
“With his respiratory problem and his age, it could be difficult to recover.”
Follow updates here.

author: Giovanni Cardarello
title: Euroleague, il Partizan controlla il secondo tempo e batte l'Olimpia al Forum
text:
Basket
Euroleague, il Partizan controlla il secondo tempo e batte l'Olimpia al Forum
I migliori realizzatori sono stati Shields e Mirotic (16 punti a testa), seguiti da Bolmaro (14 punti e 5 assist)
Incappa nella prima sconfitta del 2025 l'EA7 Milano, travolta 70-90 al Forum dal Partizan Belgrado nella sfida tra i decani delle panchine di Eurolega (Messina e Obradovic) e in un importante scontro diretto tra due chiare pretendenti alla post season. Partita fisica, spigolosa, in cui l'attacco di Milano viene spento dalla difesa allungata dei serbi, il cui pressing toglie secondi, circolazione e fluidità ai creativi dell'Olimpia.
In un Forum assiepato da tifosi tarantolati del Partizan (duemila presenze circa), l'EA7 affonda nella ripresa dopo aver condotto tutto il primo tempo (40-37), sotto i colpi del trio Brown (26), Carlik Jones (24 e 9 assist) e soprattutto Tyrique Jones (22, 8/8 da due, 7 rimbalzi e 31 di valutazione).
I serbi scappano via (61-74 al 35') e non rallentano nemmeno nel finale, ribaltando anche il doppio confronto. Milano paga la scarsa consistenza delle proprie stelle: quando si accendono Mirotic (16) e LeDay (10), si spengono Bolmaro (14) e Shields (16); e viceversa.
Non finiscono le notizie negative: la caviglia girata di Mannion all'ultima azione di gara, da valutare nelle prossime ore. Ora si apre un ciclo terribile per l'Olimpia: le sfide ad alta quota con Efes, Panathinaikos, Bayern e Zalgiris segneranno gran parte del destino europeo di Milano
LA PARTITA
L’avvio di partita è molto equilibrato, con Shields protagonista per l’Olimpia sia dalla distanza che in difesa, Bolmaro e Gillespie combinano efficacemente nei pressi del ferro mentre Koprivica e la mira perimetrale di Brown valgono il 9-7. Una tripla a testa di Bolmaro e Shields, successivamente, spinge l’EA7 Emporio Armani sul +8, l’asse Carlik – Tyrique Jones rimette però in scia il Partizan e i liberi del neoentrato LeDay scrivono il 17-13 a tabellone.
Al termine del quarto, comunque sia, Tyrique Jones continua a far valere il suo atletismo nel pitturato e i bianconeri riescono nel riaggancio sul 17-17. Dopo un gioco da quattro punti dell’ex Davies, Bolmaro continua nel suo show con la tripla e l’incursione che rilanciano Milano sul +3 ma Carlik Jones replica colpo su colpo e scrive il 27-27 contro LeDay e compagni.
A seguito di una bomba di Mirotic, l’energia di Tyrique Jones sembra dare la giusta spinta al Partizan, prima che i liberi e una penetrazione dello scatenato Bolmaro e i liberi di Shields tornino a scrivere il +6 biancorosso (37-31). Al termine del tempo, è ancora l’asse tra Carlik e Tyrique Jones a caricarsi i serbi sulle spalle e ad annullare gli effetti di una bomba di Shields per il 40-37 dopo 20’.
La ripresa comincia nel segno del Partizan, con Davies da sotto, Brown dalla distanza e soprattutto le folate di Carlik Jones a siglare anche il 42-46 ospite, prima che Brooks dimezzi il gap per l’Olimpia con un bell’appoggio al ferro. Il match si mantiene comunque sui binari dell’equilibrio, dato che alle accelerazioni di Sterling Brown replicano LeDay e soprattutto Mirotic (53-56).
Al termine del quarto, nonostante un jumper realizzato da Mannion, Brown e la precisione dalla lunetta di Tyrique Jones fanno allungare il Partizan sul +9 ma Ricci sigla il fondamentale canestro dall’arco che chiude il terzo quarto sul 58-64.
Brown continua ad essere difficilmente arginabile dall’Olimpia anche ad inizio quarto periodo, Lundberg annulla gli effetti di una bomba di Brooks e Tyrique Jones affonda la schiacciata del 61-74 a poco più di 6’ dal termine. Negli ultimi minuti di partita, Carlik Jones con i suoi 1vs1 non permette alcun riavvicinamento all’Olimpia e delle triple conclusive di Mirotic non spaventano gli avversari. Finisce 70-90. (Fonte Ufficio Stampa LBA)
IL TABELLINO
EA7 EMPORIO ARMANI OLIMPIA MILANO-PARTIZAN MOZZART BET BELGRADO 70-90 (17-17, 23-20, 18-27, 12-26).
Olimpia Milano: Mannion 2, Bortolani n.e, Garavaglia n.e, Tonut 2, Bolmaro 14, Brooks 5, LeDay 10, Ricci 3, Caruso n.e, Shields 16, Mirotic 16, Gillespie 2. Coach Messina.
Partizan Belgrado: Davies 8, Lundberg 6, C.Jones 24 (9 ast), Koprivica 2, Nakic n.e, Pokusevski 2, Brown 26 (7 reb), Bonga, Lakic, Mike, T.Jones 22 (7 reb). Coach Obradovic.
Note: 46.2-72.2% tiri da due punti, 42.9-31.8% tiri da tre punti, 62.5-94.4% tiri liberi, 24-32 rimbalzi, 14-17 assist, 15-12 palle perse, 5-11 palle recuperate.

author: Benjamin Mayo
title: Epic CEO Tim Sweeney says latest App Store changes are an 'anticompetitive scheme rife with junk fees' - 9to5Mac
text:
Apple announced a slew of App Store policy changes today to conform to the EU’s Digital Market Act, including supporting alternative app stores (Apple calls them ‘app marketplaces’) for the first time in Europe.
Epic CEO Tim Sweeney has immediately come out to criticize the changes, in a post on his X account . Sweeney says the new rules are an “anticompetitive scheme rife with junk fees”, and an example of “malicious compliance”.
Sweeney says Apple’s new polices are illegal under the terms of the Digital Market Act, because Apple forces developers to choose between the traditional 15/30% commission terms or an “also-illegal anticompetitive scheme rife with new Junk Fees and new taxes on payments they don’t process”.
Apple's plan to thwart Europe's new Digital Markets Act law is a devious new instance of Malicious Compliance.
They are forcing developers to choose between App Store exclusivity and the store terms, which will be illegal under DMA, or accept a new also-illegal anticompetitive…
— Tim Sweeney (@TimSweeneyEpic) January 25, 2024 The “Junk Fees” comment is presumably in reference to the new commission structure which includes a new Core Technology Fee. The CTF is paid per annual install, at a charge of €0.50 payable per app instance downloaded by an account per year. The CTF applies to all apps with high volume installs in excess of a million per year. The CTF also applies to any third-party app marketplaces that crop up, every time a user downloads the alternative app store.
It’s less clear what Sweeney means when he says Apple is introducing “new taxes on payments they don’t process”. The new EU commission structure lowers Apple’s commission to 17% for apps sold through the App Store, and an extra 3% if using In-App Purchase. Payments processed using alternative payment systems incur no commission.
Later in the X post, Sweeney says Epic is determined to launch the Epic Games Store on iOS and Android. But he says the current policies allows Apple to decide whether to allow Epic Games Store or not. He concludes by saying there’s a lot more “hot garbage” in Apple’s announcements today, alluding to future disclosures from the company.

author: Bloomberg
title: Elon Musk Shows UK a Post-Richard Branson's Virgin Orbit Holdings Route to Space | Opinion
text: Elon Musk Shows UK a Post-Richard Branson's Virgin Orbit Holdings Route to Space Richard Branson bowed out of the race after sinking more than $1 billion into Virgin Orbit Holdings. His net worth is $2.9 bn, compared with $232 bn for Elon Musk. Britain is in a despondent state, weighed down by a stagnating economy, accumulating evidence of its relative decline, persistent cost-of-living challenges and political infighting over immigration. The country could do with a success, a galvanizing moment of national achievement to rekindle optimism. Will space provide it? More than seven decades after British engineers first began developing rockets, 2024 may finally see the first successful launch from UK soil. Several are planned, though details are scant. The most likely site among a number of candidates is SaxaVord on the island of Unst, the first spaceport to receive approval from Britain's aviation regulator for vertical rocket launches. Unst is the northernmost of Scotland's Shetland Islands and closer to Norway than England. SaxaVord will be the first fully licensed such facility in Western Europe, according to the BBC. A successful mission would erase the bitter aftertaste of Richard Branson's Virgin Orbit Holdings Inc., whose maiden UK launch a year ago ended in failure. Taking off horizontally from the back of a modified Boeing 747 from Cornwall in southwest England, the rocket carrying nine satellites reached space but failed to enter orbit after an engine shut down prematurely. Three months later, the California-based company, which once had a market value in excess of $3.5 billion, filed for bankruptcy. There are multiple reasons to cheer the prospect of a renewed attempt. Getting satellites into orbit would be a milestone for Britain and act as a potential catalyst for its space industry, putting the sector in a position to dominate the market for European launches and attracting investment and expertise. Saxavord in particular is suitable for small rockets delivering satellites into low-Earth orbit, the segment in which the UK aims to specialize. It offers a clear ocean flight path over the North Pole and down through the Pacific, meaning rockets can travel a long way without the risk of dropping something on buildings or unsuspecting human heads — a key consideration when deciding where to blast off from. Just as important, a launch capability promises to dramatically raise the visibility of Britain's space sector, which has tended to fly under the radar. That's perhaps inevitable: If you don't participate in the most photogenic part of the process — the actual blasting of rockets out of the Earth's atmosphere — you're not going to attract much attention. Yet the industry is an under-appreciated star of Britain's economy: growing, privately funded and highly productive. The ultra-rich dominate the emerging era of commercial space flight. Elon Musk, the world's wealthiest person, has revolutionized the industry with the reusable rockets of his Space Exploration Technologies Corp., better known as SpaceX, and fantasies of colonizing Mars. Musk has feuded publicly with Jeff Bezos, who ranks second in wealth, over their space ambitions. Branson, Britain's own billionaire space champion, can't be blamed for bowing out of the race for a UK launch after sinking more than $1 billion into Virgin Orbit. He has an estimated net worth of $2.9 billion, compared with $232 billion for Musk and $179 billion for Bezos, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. The wealth of the industry's figureheads can be a distraction, according to David Willetts, chair of the UK Space Agency. “There's a view that it's a kind of rich person's hobby or toy; it's a misunderstanding,” Willetts, whose agency is charged with promoting and driving investment into the sector, told me in an interview. In reality, the US billionaires are both pursuing “smart strategic investments,” he said, aiming to create fully integrated systems that link satellite capabilities with their giant Earth-bound corporations, Amazon.com Inc. in Bezos's case and Tesla Inc. in Musk's. Similarly, Britain's space sector is very much a commercial enterprise. UK-based companies perform tasks ranging from managing the movements of hundreds of satellites and building instruments for telescopes to developing materials in space that can't be made on Earth and researching medicines in zero gravity. That's reason enough to support any endeavor that promises to accelerate its growth. Beyond the business case, though, the positive effect on a fragile public psyche might be even more valuable, showcasing not only Britain's innovation and engineering excellence but its ability to persevere in the pursuit of difficult objectives. Those concerned about the risk of another flame-out should remember the example of Musk. SpaceX's first three launches failed in the 2000s, bringing the company to the brink of collapse. As of December, it had put more than 5,000 satellites into low-Earth orbit and had a value of close to $180 billion. “I never give up,” Musk once said when asked about the failures. That might make a good motto for Britain's space program. Follow HT Tech for the latest [ tech news ](https://tech.hindustantimes.com/tech/news) and [reviews ](https://tech.hindustantimes.com/mobile/reviews), also keep up with us on [Whatsapp channel](https://whatsapp.com/channel/0029Va9iditJENxz27aoVF0k), [Google News](https://news.google.com/publications/CAAqBwgKMJK_nQswo8m1Aw?ceid=IN:en&oc=3&hl=en-IN&gl=IN), and [YouTube channel](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCUmhg3QldZiYoO9mKGpumBA). author: Tribune News Service
title: Seminars mark World Earth Day - The Tribune
text:
Seminars mark World Earth Day
The Society of Environment Management and Bio Research (SEMBR), a social organisation, organised two seminars to celebrate World Earth Day.
The programmes were celebrated under the theme, “our power, our planet” on the campus of Government Model Sanskriti Senior Secondary School, Bilaspur, and Guru Gobind Singh Pharmacy College (GGSPC), Yamunanagar.
Patron of SEMBER society, Dr KR Bhardwaj was the chief guest at both programmes.
At the school, the programme was presided over by the principal of the school Ajay Dhiman and at GGSPC by the principal, Dr Kumar Gaurav Kashyap. President of SEMBER society Ashok Kumar Kakkar welcomed the guests and audience.
On the occasion, the guests, staff members and all seminarians planted saplings on the campus of the school in Bilaspur. The students, staff members and all seminarians organised a rally to spread awareness among people to protect mother earth from the wrath of natural and man-made disasters.
In his address Bhardwaj said that World Earth Day was now a global event to sensitise and educate the general public about the need of its protection and conservation.
He focused on the origin of the earth, its internal structure and other social as well as environmental issues.

编 辑：袁天奕 孙媛媛 俞滟琦 李梦珂
漫画绘制：沈悦洁 冯巍

author: Bill Alexander
title: Sunny, dry days and clear, mild nights to persist into the early part of next week
text: CORPUS CHRISTI, Tx — Continued fair, dry conditions will prevail over the Coastal Bend through the weekend and into early next week as both surface and upper-air high pressure keep low humidity in place. A weak cold front is poised to sweep through the region late Tuesday, however, and may induce isolated rain showers. Temperatures will remain near normal through the coming week. However, in the wake of Hurricane Milton, low-period swells are still bringing coastal flooding and high risks of rip currents through Saturday. WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW - No rain through early next week - Weather conditions for Friday Night football will be clear and mild with light wind - A few showers late Tuesday will deposit little, if any, meaningful rainfall CORPUS CHRISTI FORECAST Tonight: Clear and mild Temperature: Low in the upper 60s Winds: Light southeast Tomorrow: : Sunny and warm but dry Temperature: High in the lowe 90s Winds: East wind 5 to 10 mph Saturday: Sunny, warm and dry Temperature: High in the lower 90s Winds: Southeast 4 to 8 mph Outdoor conditions will be ideal for the next several days, but beware the high rip current risk on Gulfside beaches through Saturday.
